Key Match Events: Roland Sallai scored in the 32nd minute after a fine attack.
The Dutch equalized in the second half through Denzel Dumfries’ header despite playing a man down due to Virgil van Dijk’s sending off.
Pre-Game Insights: Marco Rossi’s squad will try to attack more and win, but they have to at least get a draw to stay in the top of the Nations League.
The Hungarians have never been defeated by Bosnia and Herzegovina in the five meetings so far.
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach Marco Rossi noted that the 1-1 draw against the Netherlands is a bravura result, but he still feels a bit disappointed that the opponents managed to equalize.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hungarian national team did not lose to the Netherlands for the first time in 40 years, after nine defeats in a row.
Others: The match against Bosnia and Herzegovina will start at 8:45 p.m.
